alert.note: Alert for Brown; Cherry; Keya Paha (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 12 at 2:39AM CDT until July 12 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN CHERRY...NORTHWESTERN BROWN AND WESTERN KEYA PAHA COUNTIES... At 239 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles south of Millboro to 15 miles northeast of Valentine National Wildlife Refuge, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Johnstown, Norden, Wood Lake, North River Trail, Sparks and Smith Falls State Park. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 200 and 236. Highway 83 between mile markers 200 and 207. Highway 12 between mile markers 8 and 39, and between mile markers 41 and 44. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
